member.name: D3D11_MAP
member.summary: Identifies a resource to be accessed for reading and writing by the CPU. Applications may combine one or more of these flags.

member.name: D3D11_MAP.D3D11_MAP_READ
member.summary: Resource is mapped for reading. The resource must have been created with read access (see ).

member.name: D3D11_MAP.D3D11_MAP_WRITE
member.summary: Resource is mapped for writing. The resource must have been created with write access (see ).

member.name: D3D11_MAP.D3D11_MAP_READ_WRITE
member.summary: Resource is mapped for reading and writing. The resource must have been created with read and write access (see ).

member.name: D3D11_MAP.D3D11_MAP_WRITE_DISCARD
member.summary: Resource is mapped for writing; the previous contents of the resource will be undefined. The resource must have been created with write access and dynamic usage (See and ).

summary.para: Resource is mapped for writing; the existing contents of the resource cannot be overwritten (see Remarks). This flag is only valid on vertex and index buffers. The resource must have been created with write access (see ). Cannot be used on a resource created with the flag.
summary.div: Note The Direct3D 11.1 runtime, which is available starting with Windows 8, enables mapping dynamic constant buffers and shader resource views (SRVs) of dynamic buffers with . The Direct3D 11 and earlier runtimes limited mapping to vertex or index buffers. To determine if a Direct3D device supports these features, call with . CheckFeatureSupport fills members of a structure with the device's features. The relevant members here are MapNoOverwriteOnDynamicConstantBuffer and MapNoOverwriteOnDynamicBufferSRV.
